dcterms:creator: ISO
dcterms:description: A standard for measuring room acoustic parameters specifically in open plan offices, focusing on speech intelligibility and background noise distribution.
dcterms:title: ISO 3382-3

dcterms:creator: S. JÃ¸rgensen
S. D. Ewert
T. Dau
dcterms:description: A multi-resolution envelope-power based model designed to predict speech intelligibility in various acoustic environments, particularly useful for multi-talker scenarios.
dcterms:title: mr-sEPSM (multi-resolution speech based envelope power spectrum model)

dcterms:creator: ANSI
dcterms:description: An American National Standard that outlines methods for calculating the speech intelligibility index, which is crucial for assessing communication effectiveness in various environments.
dcterms:title: ANSI S3.5-1997 (R2007)

dcterms:creator: A. Hampshire
R. R. Highfield
B. L. Parkin
A. M. Owen
dcterms:description: A dataset that provides various cognitive tests to assess human intelligence, used in the context of understanding cognitive performance in different environments.
dcterms:title: Cambridge Brain Science (CBS)

dcterms:creator: M. Schutte
A. Marks
E. Wenning
B. Griefahn
dcterms:description: A questionnaire developed to assess individual sensitivity to noise, which can impact cognitive performance and subjective distraction in various environments.
dcterms:title: Noise Sensitivity Questionnaire (NoiSeQ)

dcterms:creator: S. G. Hart
L. E. Staveland
dcterms:description: A widely used tool for assessing perceived workload across various tasks, which can be influenced by environmental factors such as noise.
dcterms:title: NASA Task Load Index (NASA-TLX)
